text:
From bottle @Grouse Mountain, North Vancouver.
Small, white head, yellow/golden colour, clear. Aroma: malts, wet cardboard. Bitter taste. Light body, long finish, lively. Nicely refreshing.

Aroma is citrus, clove , lemongrass and hay. Taste is light sweet malts, honey and lemongrass. Finishes with a light earthiness. Appearance is a clear gold with a thin pearl head that retains quit well.

473ml can pours a pale straw color with a finger of white head that leaves a few spots of lacing on the glass. Aroma is light fruits with some citrus, grass and hints of pepper. Taste is a light fruity and malty sweetness with a light citrus and grass hop bitterness with a peppery finish. Light bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall, a nicely done brew that is a good representation of the style.

Rating #1724 - 2015.06.03 Bottle from CBI - Pours a clear straw yellow with a bubbly white cap. Medium carbonation, low alcohol warmth. Mouthfeel is crisp, clean, very light. Light spiciness from hops on palate. Refreshing.
Clear golden appearance. Remarkably crisp texture with some grainy notes. Highly drinkable.

650ml bottle. (5.0% ABV) Pours a hazy pale yellow with a medium, frothy, long lasting, white head that laces nicely. Sweet, floral aroma of pear, lemon, grain and grass. Sweet flavour of pear, lemon, bready malt and grain with a mildly bitter grass finish. Light body with a watery texture and soft carbonation. A pretty good kolsch.
Bottle shared with Rockley. Hazy light gold. Pleasant clean grains and lightly floral yeast character, hints of citrus. Low sweetness, low bitterness. Better than expected.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: I got this in a 650mL bomber. The pour was golden straw with nice active effervescence resulting in a decent sized off-white head that subsided quickly and left a nice lacing around the glass. Carbonated but not fizzy, this had grassy bready notes on the nose and a pleasant mouthfeel. Slightly more than watery, which is how I like my Kölsch style ales. The taste was mildly peppery and grassy with a nice not too-bitter aftertaste of nutty citrus. I enjoyed this more than my last Kölsch actually from Köln.
This is my beer from these guys, goes to show talent of they young brewer. I go there fro a beer this is what I get.
Pours clear orange yellow, fine off-white foam. Grassy grainy lager malt aroma. Light herbal bitterness, mild biscuity malt, nice lemony citrus tang. Low carbonation, lighter bodied, lightly hopped.
Draft - Light sweet grains. Hazy gold with a decent beige head. Light citrus and some bitterness. Finishes with grains and citrus bitterness.

Bomber. Mostly clear oranger yellow, fine off-white foam mostly lasts. Grassy grainy lager malt aroma. Light herbal bitterness, mild biscuity malt, grassy, nice lemony citrus tang. Above average carbonation, lighter bodied, lightly hopped. Refreshing and sessional. MLF (More Lagerboy Friendly)

Golden colour, chill haze, fairly large bubbles for a craft beer and medium-thick head. The aroma is a bit grainy, with some damp dog-smelling noble hops. Moderate bitterness, though hop character isnt super fresh. The malts are pale, and a touch gooey (though one or two indigenous kölsch also have that character. Finishes with more of those malts and some bitterness. The sense of balance is quite good but the individual elements arent all that bright.

Where and how:  bottle 650 ml CBA 
Aroma frontal softness, floral, hint of wheat(?). Nice zesty floral hop touch. Pleasant nose. Perhaps tad too soft for traditional Kolsch.
 Appearance : 
Top: plus sized bright white cap.
Base: slight haze, golden.
Palate :  medium bodied, up front soft with dry sides. 
Taste: clean mid sitting golden malt with lingering bitterness above.
 Other notes  maybe tad soft for style, still quite tasty brew.
650 ml bottle. Slightly hazy straw color with moderate persistent head. Aromas of dough, light citrus, and salt. Flavors are similar with a strong grassy bitter finish.

Bomber. Cloudy yellow, not much head (the cap was pretty loose... its not stale though). Nose is kolsch lemon/orange/pear, grass, pils malt. Flavour is pretty rounded pear and pils, carb is pretty low, good until the finish which is slightly harsh and quite medicinal. The finish comes out of nowhere. Phenol problem. Hard one to rate;  best not to overthink it and make an ass of myself.

Jaune pale avec une mousse moyenne blanche avec de bon retention. Larôme des céréales un peu herbeux. Le goût est du malt léger, les céréales très très fraîches, avec une finition très frais avec un léger amertume. Très rafraîchissante.

Slightly hazy yellow with a pale head. Aroma is freshly baked bread, biscuit, grass, field flowers. Light bodied, subtly bitter on the palate with a bready background. Taste is bread, grass, citrus peel. Reasonably good Kölsch but the hops seem a little off for the style.

Bottle, pours a clear pale yellow with a small white head. Nose brings out fresh cereal, forward grassy hops, as a really dry freshness. Flavour is similar, bringing out super fresh grassy hops, dry cereal malts, and cracker. Finishes almost lemony, with cereals and grass. A wonderful thirst-quenching hoppy kolsch.

2014-03-21 draught at the brewery16ozServed too cold. The aroma takes some time to develop, its more grassy than cereally, and it seems less delicate and more bitter than last week.2014-03-14, draught at the brewery, 
9-4-7-4-17=4116ozHazy blond color with a green and gold hue; compact head. The aroma is subtle but fantastic, with end of summer fields of cereals, breadcrust, hay; Im space traveling back to Germany. Lean, dry mouthfeel; the carbonation is slightly excessive; gentle crisp malt flavor, hint of cereals, and bold herbaceous hopping.This really captured the essence of a kolsch!
